definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: Blair: Well, lucky for you, your friend is someone I actually care about.
sentences.chinese: 算你走运，你的那位朋友碰巧是我挺在乎的一个人。

sentences.english: We were a bit unlucky but still a good place to finish.
sentences.chinese: 我有些不走运，但还是以不错的名次完赛了。

sentences.english: Good luck, let's hope he is not afraid of hitchhikers.
sentences.chinese: 祝你走运，但愿他不害怕路人搭车。

sentences.english: About 18 months ago she hit the jackpot.
sentences.chinese: 大概在18个月前，她走运了。

sentences.english: Example: Enjoy it! You can't have too much of a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 见好就收吧你不可能太走运了。

sentences.english: I'm lucky that I didn't miss my final exam after having 30 minutes of unprotected sleep.
sentences.chinese: 我真走运，睡了30分钟的回笼觉还没错过期末考试。

sentences.english: He loves to score goals and was unlucky not to get on the scoresheet today.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢破门得分，而他今天未能进球实在是不走运。

sentences.english: Remember how I said I was lucky to get a speaking part?
sentences.chinese: 记得我说我还挺走运，捡了个有台词的角色么？

sentences.english: We're the luckiest sons -of-bitches in the word.
sentences.chinese: 我们是真他妈的走运极了。

sentences.english: Realize that the harder you work, the luckier you will become.
sentences.chinese: 要记住，你的工作越难搞，你将越走运。

sentences.english: I'm so happy for her, it's totally her year.
sentences.chinese: 我真为她高兴，今年她很走运。

sentences.english: Talent goon who is not in luck by named.
sentences.chinese: 被称为“不走运的天才打手”。

sentences.english: Ueberroth was, among other things, preternaturally lucky.
sentences.chinese: 尤伯罗斯，真的是一个很走运的人。

sentences.english: Some people think that it's bad luck to wear a birthstone that isn't yours.
sentences.chinese: 一些人认为带着别人的诞生石不走运。

sentences.english: They did not win everything last season by fluke.
sentences.chinese: 在上赛季很不走运他们没有赢得任何比赛。

sentences.english: Fortunately, I picked winners back to back in the last few races.
sentences.chinese: 我很走运，在最后几场马赛中，接二连三地赌赢了。

definition: to have bad luck/to be out of luck
to have a lucky stroke/to try one's luck
winner/lucky guy/person who always gets good breaks
to run into/to come upon/to meet
the year's horoscope augurs ill (idiom); an unlucky year
